        This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<!----></span><br><br>If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label. To disable this altogether, apply ReleaseBlock-NA.<span class="line"><!---->If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label.           Comment 19<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      cclao@google.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2933280089" title="cclao@google.com"><!---->cclao@google.com<!----></a>
      cclao@google.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->cclao@google.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I think what happened is that ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex) will always allocate space for the default attributes, regardless if the attribute index is enabled or not. Then it calls vertexArrayVk->updateDefaultAttrib(), which only updates mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex] if it is enabled:    <span class="line"><!---->I think what happened is that ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex) will always allocate space for the default attributes, regardless if the attribute index is enabled or not. Then it calls vertexArrayVk-&gt;updateDefaultAttrib(), which only updates mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex] if it is enabled:    <!----></span><br><br>if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))<span class="line"><!---->if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBufferHandles[attribIndex] = bufferHandle;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBufferHandles[attribIndex] = bufferHandle;<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex] = offset;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex] = offset;<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]       = buffer;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]       = buffer;<!----></span><br><br>        ANGLE_TRY(setDefaultPackedInput(contextVk, attribIndex));<span class="line"><!---->        ANGLE_TRY(setDefaultPackedInput(contextVk, attribIndex));<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>This means if mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex)) is true, mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]  will still point to the previous buffer, which may have been pushed to mInflightBuffers by this call:<span class="line"><!---->This means if mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex)) is true, mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]  will still point to the previous buffer, which may have been pushed to mInflightBuffers by this call:<!----></span><br><br>angle::Result ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex)<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    vk::BufferHelper *defaultBuffer;<span class="line"><!---->    vk::BufferHelper *defaultBuffer;<!----></span><br>    ANGLE_TRY(allocateStreamedVertexBuffer(attribIndex, kDefaultValueSize, &defaultBuffer));<span class="line"><!---->    ANGLE_TRY(allocateStreamedVertexBuffer(attribIndex, kDefaultValueSize, &amp;defaultBuffer));<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>And then at submission time, we decided to release the mInflightBuffers, the BufferHelper object gets deleted (note, the underline VkBuffer will be garbage collected instead of immediately destroyed, but the helper object gets destructed), while mCurrentArrayBuffers still pointing to it, thus the use-after-free.<span class="line"><!---->And then at submission time, we decided to release the mInflightBuffers, the BufferHelper object gets deleted (note, the underline VkBuffer will be garbage collected instead of immediately destroyed, but the helper object gets destructed), while mCurrentArrayBuffers still pointing to it, thus the use-after-free.<!----></span><br><br>The easy fix is to add  `if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))` check before calling allocateStreamedVertexBuffer() so that we do not waste time to allocate and not use it, and mean time fix this bug as well.<span class="line"><!---->The easy fix is to add  `if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))` check before calling allocateStreamedVertexBuffer() so that we do not waste time to allocate and not use it, and mean time fix this bug as well.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

Then we call into<span class="line"><!---->default attribute, regardless it is enabled or not. This causes a use-after-free scenario that if it<span class="line"><!---->attribute is enabled. This causes a use-after-free scenario that if it<!----></span><br>is disabled, the vertex array may have a pointer to the buffer that is<span class="line"><!---->is disabled, the vertex array may have a pointer to the buffer that is<!----></span><br>now becomes inflight which may gets deleted when DynamicBuffer code<span class="line"><!---->now becomes inflight which may gets deleted when DynamicBuffer code<!----></span><br>think the size no longer matches etc.<span class="line"><!---->think the size no longer matches etc.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1296467<a           Comment 21<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

See <!----></span>comment #23<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c23"><!---->comment #23<!----></a>, it appears already rolled into chromium. Let me know if my understanding is incorrect, or still seeing the bug.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is a heap use-after-free vulnerability that could be triggered in Swiftshader.<span class="line"><!---->There is a heap use-after-free vulnerability that could be triggered in Swiftshader.<!----></span><br>I think that this vulnerability started in commit <span class="line"><!---->I think that this vulnerability started in commit <!----></span>1608a9567b66c92cb346682a6e9e2aece070b181<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/1608a9567b66c92cb346682a6e9e2aece070b181"><!---->1608a9567b66c92cb346682a6e9e2aece070b181<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>The attached PoC has already been minimized as far as I can.<span class="line"><!---->The attached PoC has already been minimized as far as I can.<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: master (and tested on 100.0.4878.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) dev)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: master (and tested on 100.0.4878.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) dev)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 x64<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 x64<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Run the attached poc.html (with --disable-gpu)<span class="line"><!---->Run the attached poc.html (with --disable-gpu)<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: GPU Process<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: GPU Process<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==4072==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x1209725ab9c4 at pc 0x7ffc11c4a1e7 bp 0x00a595dfe4a0 sp 0x00a595dfe4e8<span class="line"><!---->==4072==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x1209725ab9c4 at pc 0x7ffc11c4a1e7 bp 0x00a595dfe4a0 sp 0x00a595dfe4e8<!----></span><br>READ of size 4 at 0x1209725ab9c4 thread T0<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 4 at 0x1209725ab9c4 thread T0<!----></span><br>==4072==WARNING: Failed to use and restart external symbolizer!<span class="line"><!---->==4072==WARNING: Failed to use and restart external symbolizer!<!----></span><br>==4072==*** WARNING: Failed to initialize DbgHelp!              ***<span class="line"><!---->==4072==*** WARNING: Failed to initialize DbgHelp!              ***<!----></span><br>==4072==*** Most likely this means that the app is already      ***<span class="line"><!---->==4072==*** Most likely this means that the app is already      ***<!----></span><br>==4072==*** using DbgHelp, possibly with incompatible flags.    ***<span class="line"><!---->==4072==*** using DbgHelp, possibly with incompatible flags.    ***<!----></span><br>==4072==*** Due to technical reasons, symbolization might crash ***<span class="line"><!---->==4072==*** Due to technical reasons, symbolization might crash ***<!----></span><br>==4072==*** or produce wrong results.                           ***<span class="line"><!---->==4072==*** or produce wrong results.                           ***<!----></span><br>    #0 0x7ffc11c4a1e6 in rx::vk::BufferHelper::recordReadBarrier C:\b\s\w\ir\cache\builder\src\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\vk_helpers.cpp:4262<span class="line"><!---->    #0 0x7ffc11c4a1e6 in rx::vk::BufferHelper::recordReadBarrier C:\b\s\w\ir\cache\builder\src\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\vk_helpers.cpp:4262<!----></span><br>    #1 0x7ffc11c49d63 in rx::vk::CommandBufferHelperCommon::bufferRead         This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a serious security regression. To disable this altogether, apply ReleaseBlock-NA.<span class="line"><!---->If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label.           Comment 19<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      cclao@google.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2933280089" title="cclao@google.com"><!---->cclao@google.com<!----></a>
      cclao@google.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->cclao@google.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I think what happened is that ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex) will always allocate space for the default attributes, regardless if the attribute index is enabled or not. Then it calls vertexArrayVk->updateDefaultAttrib(), which only updates mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex] if it is enabled:    <span class="line"><!---->I think what happened is that ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex) will always allocate space for the default attributes, regardless if the attribute index is enabled or not. Then it calls vertexArrayVk-&gt;updateDefaultAttrib(), which only updates mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex] if it is enabled:    <!----></span><br><br>if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))<span class="line"><!---->if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBufferHandles[attribIndex] = bufferHandle;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBufferHandles[attribIndex] = bufferHandle;<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex] = offset;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex] = offset;<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]       = buffer;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]       = buffer;<!----></span><br><br>        ANGLE_TRY(setDefaultPackedInput(contextVk, attribIndex));<span class="line"><!---->        ANGLE_TRY(setDefaultPackedInput(contextVk, attribIndex));<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>This means if mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex)) is true, mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]  will still point to the previous buffer, which may have been pushed to mInflightBuffers by this call:<span class="line"><!---->This means if mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex)) is true, mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]  will still point to the previous buffer, which may have been pushed to mInflightBuffers by this call:<!----></span><br><br>angle::Result ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex)<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    vk::BufferHelper *defaultBuffer;<span class="line"><!---->    vk::BufferHelper *defaultBuffer;<!----></span><br>    ANGLE_TRY(allocateStreamedVertexBuffer(attribIndex, kDefaultValueSize, &defaultBuffer));<span class="line"><!---->    ANGLE_TRY(allocateStreamedVertexBuffer(attribIndex, kDefaultValueSize, &amp;defaultBuffer));<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>And then at submission time, we decided to release the mInflightBuffers, the BufferHelper object gets deleted (note, the underline VkBuffer will be garbage collected instead of immediately destroyed, but the helper object gets destructed), while mCurrentArrayBuffers still pointing to it, thus the use-after-free.<span class="line"><!---->And then at submission time, we decided to release the mInflightBuffers, the BufferHelper object gets deleted (note, the underline VkBuffer will be garbage collected instead of immediately destroyed, but the helper object gets destructed), while mCurrentArrayBuffers still pointing to it, thus the use-after-free.<!----></span><br><br>The easy fix is to add  `if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))` check before calling allocateStreamedVertexBuffer() so that we do not waste time to allocate and not use it, and mean time fix this bug as well.<span class="line"><!---->The easy fix is to add  `if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))` check before calling allocateStreamedVertexBuffer() so that we do not waste time to allocate and not use it, and mean time fix this bug as well.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is a heap use-after-free vulnerability that could be triggered in Swiftshader.<span class="line"><!---->There is a heap use-after-free vulnerability that could be triggered in Swiftshader.<!----></span><br>I think that this vulnerability started in commit <span class="line"><!---->I think that this vulnerability started in commit <!----></span>1608a9567b66c92cb346682a6e9e2aece070b181<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/1608a9567b66c92cb346682a6e9e2aece070b181"><!---->1608a9567b66c92cb346682a6e9e2aece070b181<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>The attached PoC has already been minimized as far as I can.<span class="line"><!---->The attached PoC has already been minimized as far as I can.<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: master (and tested on 100.0.4878.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) dev)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: master (and tested on 100.0.4878.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) dev)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 x64<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 x64<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Run the attached poc.html (with --disable-gpu)<span class="line"><!---->Run the attached poc.html (with --disable-gpu)<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: GPU Process<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: GPU Process<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==4072==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x1209725ab9c4 at pc 0x7ffc11c4a1e7 bp 0x00a595dfe4a0 sp 0x00a595dfe4e8<span class="line"><!---->==4072==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x1209725ab9c4 at pc 0x7ffc11c4a1e7 bp 0x00a595dfe4a0 sp 0x00a595dfe4e8<!----></span><br>READ of size 4 at 0x1209725ab9c4 thread T0<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 4 at 0x1209725ab9c4 thread T0<!----></span><br>==4072==WARNING: Failed to use and restart external symbolizer!<span class="line"><!---->==4072==WARNING: Failed to use and restart external symbolizer!<!----></span><br>==4072==*** WARNING: Failed to initialize DbgHelp!              ***<span class="line"><!---->==4072==*** WARNING: Failed to initialize DbgHelp!              ***<!----></span><br>==4072==*** Most likely this means that the app is already      ***<span class="line"><!---->==4072==*** Most likely this means that the app is already      ***<!----></span><br>==4072==*** using DbgHelp, possibly with incompatible flags.    ***<span class="line"><!---->==4072==*** using DbgHelp, possibly with incompatible flags.    ***<!----></span><br>==4072==*** Due to technical reasons, symbolization might crash ***<span class="line"><!---->==4072==*** Due to technical reasons, symbolization might crash ***<!----></span><br>==4072==*** or produce wrong results.                           ***<span class="line"><!---->==4072==*** or produce wrong results.                           ***<!----></span><br>    #0 0x7ffc11c4a1e6 in rx::vk::BufferHelper::recordReadBarrier C:\b\s\w\ir\cache\builder\src\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\vk_helpers.cpp:4262<span class="line"><!---->    #0 0x7ffc11c4a1e6 in rx::vk::BufferHelper::recordReadBarrier C:\b\s\w\ir\cache\builder\src\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\vk_helpers.cpp:1057<span class="line"><!---->    #1 0x7ffc11c49d63 in rx::vk::CommandBufferHelperCommon::bufferRead           Comment 19<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      cclao@google.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2933280089" title="cclao@google.com"><!---->cclao@google.com<!----></a>
      cclao@google.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->cclao@google.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I think what happened is that ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex) will always allocate space for the default attributes, regardless if the attribute index is enabled or not. Then it calls vertexArrayVk->updateDefaultAttrib(), which only updates mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex] if it is enabled:    <span class="line"><!---->I think what happened is that ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex) will always allocate space for the default attributes, regardless if the attribute index is enabled or not. Then it calls vertexArrayVk-&gt;updateDefaultAttrib(), which only updates mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex] if it is enabled:    <!----></span><br><br>if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))<span class="line"><!---->if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBufferHandles[attribIndex] = bufferHandle;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBufferHandles[attribIndex] = bufferHandle;<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex] = offset;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex] = offset;<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]       = buffer;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]       = buffer;<!----></span><br><br>        ANGLE_TRY(setDefaultPackedInput(contextVk, attribIndex));<span class="line"><!---->        ANGLE_TRY(setDefaultPackedInput(contextVk, attribIndex));<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>This means if mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex)) is true, mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]  will still point to the previous buffer, which may have been pushed to mInflightBuffers by this call:<span class="line"><!---->This means if mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex)) is true, mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]  will still point to the previous buffer, which may have been pushed to mInflightBuffers by this call:<!----></span><br><br>angle::Result ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex)<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    vk::BufferHelper *defaultBuffer;<span class="line"><!---->    vk::BufferHelper *defaultBuffer;<!----></span><br>    ANGLE_TRY(allocateStreamedVertexBuffer(attribIndex, kDefaultValueSize, &defaultBuffer));<span class="line"><!---->    ANGLE_TRY(allocateStreamedVertexBuffer(attribIndex, kDefaultValueSize, &amp;defaultBuffer));<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>And then at submission time, we decided to release the mInflightBuffers, the BufferHelper object gets deleted (note, the underline VkBuffer will be garbage collected instead of immediately destroyed, but the helper object gets destructed), while mCurrentArrayBuffers still pointing to it, thus the use-after-free.<span class="line"><!---->And then at submission time, we decided to release the mInflightBuffers, the BufferHelper object gets deleted (note, the underline VkBuffer will be garbage collected instead of immediately destroyed, but the helper object gets destructed), while mCurrentArrayBuffers still pointing to it, thus the use-after-free.<!----></span><br><br>The easy fix is to add  `if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))` check before calling allocateStreamedVertexBuffer() so that we do not waste time to allocate and not use it, and mean time fix this bug as well.<span class="line"><!---->The easy fix is to add  `if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))` check before calling allocateStreamedVertexBuffer() so that we do not waste time to allocate and not use it, and mean time fix this bug as well.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        ClusterFuzz testcase 5827705727418368 is still reproducing on tip-of-tree build (trunk).<span class="line"><!---->ClusterFuzz testcase 5827705727418368 is still reproducing on tip-of-tree build (trunk).<!----></span><br><br>Please re-test your fix against this testcase and if the fix was incorrect or incomplete, please re-open the bug.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is a heap use-after-free vulnerability that could be triggered in Swiftshader.<span class="line"><!---->There is a heap use-after-free vulnerability that could be triggered in Swiftshader.<!----></span><br>I think that this vulnerability started in commit <span class="line"><!---->I think that this vulnerability started in commit <!----></span>1608a9567b66c92cb346682a6e9e2aece070b181<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/1608a9567b66c92cb346682a6e9e2aece070b181"><!---->1608a9567b66c92cb346682a6e9e2aece070b181<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>The attached PoC has already been minimized as far as I can.<span class="line"><!---->The attached PoC has already been minimized as far as I can.<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: master (and tested on 100.0.4878.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) dev)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: master (and tested on 100.0.4878.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) dev)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 x64<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 x64<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Run the attached poc.html (with --disable-gpu)<span class="line"><!---->Run the attached poc.html (with --disable-gpu)<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL         This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<!----></span><br><br>If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label. To disable this altogether, apply ReleaseBlock-NA.<span class="line"><!---->If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label.           Comment 19<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      cclao@google.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2933280089" title="cclao@google.com"><!---->cclao@google.com<!----></a>
      cclao@google.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->cclao@google.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I think what happened is that ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex) will always allocate space for the default attributes, regardless if the attribute index is enabled or not. Then it calls vertexArrayVk->updateDefaultAttrib(), which only updates mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex] if it is enabled:    <span class="line"><!---->I think what happened is that ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex) will always allocate space for the default attributes, regardless if the attribute index is enabled or not. Then it calls vertexArrayVk-&gt;updateDefaultAttrib(), which only updates mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex] if it is enabled:    <!----></span><br><br>if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))<span class="line"><!---->if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBufferHandles[attribIndex] = bufferHandle;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBufferHandles[attribIndex] = bufferHandle;<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex] = offset;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex] = offset;<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]       = buffer;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]       = buffer;<!----></span><br><br>        ANGLE_TRY(setDefaultPackedInput(contextVk, attribIndex));<span class="line"><!---->        ANGLE_TRY(setDefaultPackedInput(contextVk, attribIndex));<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>This means if mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex)) is true, mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]  will still point to the previous buffer, which may have been pushed to mInflightBuffers by this call:<span class="line"><!---->This means if mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex)) is true, mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]  will still point to the previous buffer, which may have been pushed to mInflightBuffers by this call:<!----></span><br><br>angle::Result ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex)<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    vk::BufferHelper *defaultBuffer;<span class="line"><!---->    vk::BufferHelper *defaultBuffer;<!----></span><br>    ANGLE_TRY(allocateStreamedVertexBuffer(attribIndex, kDefaultValueSize, &defaultBuffer));<span class="line"><!---->    ANGLE_TRY(allocateStreamedVertexBuffer(attribIndex, kDefaultValueSize, &amp;defaultBuffer));<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>And then at submission time, we decided to release the mInflightBuffers, the BufferHelper object gets deleted (note, the underline VkBuffer will be garbage collected instead of immediately destroyed, but the helper object gets destructed), while mCurrentArrayBuffers still pointing to it, thus the use-after-free.<span class="line"><!---->And then at submission time, we decided to release the mInflightBuffers, the BufferHelper object gets deleted (note, the underline VkBuffer will be garbage collected instead of immediately destroyed, but the helper object gets destructed), while mCurrentArrayBuffers still pointing to it, thus the use-after-free.<!----></span><br><br>The easy fix is to add  `if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))` check before calling allocateStreamedVertexBuffer() so that we do not waste time to allocate and not use it, and mean time fix this bug as well.<span class="line"><!---->The easy fix is to add  `if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))` check before calling allocateStreamedVertexBuffer() so that we do not waste time to allocate and not use it, and mean time fix this bug as well.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        by

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

class="line"><!---->[6284:6312:0211/143457.152:ERROR:gpu_process_host.cc(974)] GPU process exited unexpectedly: exit_code=1<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b         ggabu423@ thanks for the report.<span class="line"><!---->ggabu423@ thanks for the report.<!----></span><br><br>ClusterFuzz has found that this currently results in a null pointer deref, which of course we don't consider to be a security vulnerability. That was with Chrome head <span class="line"><!---->ClusterFuzz has found that this currently results in a null pointer deref, which of course we don't consider to be a security vulnerability. That was with Chrome head <!----></span>revision 970472<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/970472"><!---->revision 970472<!----></a>. I don't know why that's different from the use-after-free you're seeing.<span class="line"><!---->. I don't know why that's different from the use-after-free you're seeing.<!----></span><br><br>ClusterFuzz has also decided that this is a duplicate of <span class="line"><!---->ClusterFuzz has also decided that this is a duplicate of <!----></span>issue 1295411<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1295411" title="Security: [ANGLE] Heap use-after-free in CommandBufferHelperCommon::bufferWrite"><!---->issue 1295411<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>which in turn it thought was a duplicate of <span class="line"><!---->which in turn it thought was a duplicate of <!----></span>issue 1252274<span class="line"><!---->issue 1252274<!----></span>. I don't think it's making duplicate assessments correctly.<span class="line"><!---->. I don't think it's making duplicate assessments correctly.<!----></span><br><br>I'll try to run this on a Windows bot just in case that somehow changes timings and reveals a UaF here.<span class="line"><!---->I'll try to run this on a Windows bot just in case that somehow changes timings and reveals a UaF here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        @adetaylor<span class="line"><!---->@adetaylor<!----></span><br><br>I think that minimize task of 5827705727418368 is incorrect.<span class="line"><!---->I think that minimize task of 5827705727418368 is incorrect.<!----></span><br>Before minimize task was performed, I saw the use-after-free log(the same I attached) in the crash stacktrace of 5827705727418368.<span class="line"><!---->Before minimize task was performed, I saw the use-after-free log(the same I attached) in the crash stacktrace of 5827705727418368.<!----></span><br>However, after the minimize task, the asan log was changed to null-deref.<span class="line"><!---->However, after the minimize task, the asan log was changed to null-deref.<!----></span><br>(And I don't know why ClusterFuzz decided it was a duplicate, but this also seems to be wrong.)<span class="line"><!---->(And I don't know why ClusterFuzz decided it was a duplicate, but this also seems to be wrong.)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<!----></span><br><br>If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label. To disable this altogether, apply ReleaseBlock-NA.<span class="line"><!---->If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label. To disable this altogether, apply ReleaseBlock-NA.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 19<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      cclao@google.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2933280089" title="cclao@google.com"><!---->cclao@google.com<!----></a>
      cclao@google.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->cclao@google.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I think what happened is that ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex) will always allocate space for the default attributes, regardless if the attribute index is enabled or not. Then it calls vertexArrayVk->updateDefaultAttrib(), which only updates mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex] if it is enabled:    <span class="line"><!---->I think what happened is that ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex) will always allocate space for the default attributes, regardless if the attribute index is enabled or not. Then it calls vertexArrayVk-&gt;updateDefaultAttrib(), which only updates mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex] if it is enabled:    <!----></span><br><br>if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))<span class="line"><!---->if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBufferHandles[attribIndex] = bufferHandle;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBufferHandles[attribIndex] = bufferHandle;<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex] = offset;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex] = offset;<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]       = buffer;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]       = buffer;<!----></span><br><br>        ANGLE_TRY(setDefaultPackedInput(contextVk, attribIndex));<span class="line"><!---->        ANGLE_TRY(setDefaultPackedInput(contextVk, attribIndex));<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>This means if mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex)) is true, mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]  will still point to the previous buffer, which may have been pushed to mInflightBuffers by this call:<span class="line"><!---->This means if mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex)) is true, mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]  will still point to the previous buffer, which may have been pushed to mInflightBuffers by this call:<!----></span><br><br>angle::Result ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex)<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    vk::BufferHelper *defaultBuffer;<span class="line"><!---->    vk::BufferHelper *defaultBuffer;<!----></span><br>    ANGLE_TRY(allocateStreamedVertexBuffer(attribIndex, kDefaultValueSize, &defaultBuffer));<span class="line"><!---->    ANGLE_TRY(allocateStreamedVertexBuffer(attribIndex, kDefaultValueSize, &amp;defaultBuffer));<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>And then at submission time, we decided to release the mInflightBuffers, the BufferHelper object gets deleted (note, the underline VkBuffer will be garbage collected instead of immediately destroyed, but the helper object gets destructed), while mCurrentArrayBuffers still pointing to it, thus the use-after-free.<span class="line"><!---->And then at submission time, we decided to release the mInflightBuffers, the BufferHelper object gets deleted (note, the underline VkBuffer will be garbage collected instead of immediately destroyed, but the helper object gets destructed), while mCurrentArrayBuffers still pointing to it, thus the use-after-free.<!----></span><br><br>The easy fix is to add  `if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))` check before calling allocateStreamedVertexBuffer() so that we do not waste time to allocate and not use it, and mean time fix this bug as well.<span class="line"><!---->The easy fix is to add  `if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))` check before calling allocateStreamedVertexBuffer() so that we do not waste time to allocate and not use it, and mean time fix this bug as well.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/angle/angle/+/d4ddd0c1990d9ff0a20feeed36c6a7cf75f2745a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/angle/angle/+/d4ddd0c1990d9ff0a20feeed36c6a7cf75f2745a"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/angle/angle/+/d4ddd0c1990d9ff0a20feeed36c6a7cf75f2745a<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>d4ddd0c1990d9ff0a20feeed36c6a7cf75f2745a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/d4ddd0c1990d9ff0a20feeed36c6a7cf75f2745a"><!---->d4ddd0c1990d9ff0a20feeed36c6a7cf75f2745a<!----></a><br>Author: Charlie Lao <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Charlie Lao &lt;<!----></span>cclao@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/cclao@google.com"><!---->cclao@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Mar 11 00:31:00 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Mar 11 00:31:00 2022<!----></span><br><br>Vulkan: Handle the case where the bound buffer is empty<span class="line"><!---->Vulkan: Handle the case where the bound buffer is empty<!----></span><br><br>If vertex attribute is enabled and buffer is bound, but buffer size is<span class="line"><!---->If vertex attribute is enabled and buffer is bound, but buffer size is<!----></span><br>0, we should not crash. This CL skips mapImpl and data copy all together<span class="line"><!---->0, we should not crash. This CL skips mapImpl and data copy all together<!----></span><br>if size is 0 to avoid crash when calling mapImpl while buffer is<span class="line"><!---->if size is 0 to avoid crash when calling mapImpl while buffer is<!----></span><br>invalid.<span class="line"><!---->invalid.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also added a test for this.<span class="line"><!---->This CL also added a test for this.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1296467<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1296467" title="Security: [ANGLE] Heap use-after-free in BufferHelper::recordReadBarrier"><!---->Bug: chromium:1296467<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I79af348f133e1d3b4427f044e370652d0875dc91<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id:           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        ggabu423@ thanks for the report.<span class="line"><!---->ggabu423@ thanks for the report.<!----></span><br><br>ClusterFuzz has found that this currently results in a null pointer deref, which of course we don't consider to be a security vulnerability. That was with Chrome head <span class="line"><!---->ClusterFuzz has found that this currently results in a null pointer deref, which of course we don't consider to be a security vulnerability. That was with Chrome head <!----></span>revision 970472<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/970472"><!---->revision 970472<!----></a>. I don't know why that's different from the use-after-free you're seeing.<span class="line"><!---->. I don't know why that's different from the use-after-free you're seeing.<!----></span><br><br>ClusterFuzz has also decided that this is a duplicate of <span class="line"><!---->ClusterFuzz has also decided that this is a duplicate of <!----></span>issue 1295411<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1295411" title="Security: [ANGLE] Heap use-after-free in CommandBufferHelperCommon::bufferWrite"><!---->issue 1295411<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>which in turn it thought was a duplicate of <span class="line"><!---->which in turn it thought was a duplicate of <!----></span>issue 1252274<span class="line"><!---->issue 1252274<!----></span>.         This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<!----></span><br><br>If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label. To disable this altogether, apply ReleaseBlock-NA.<span class="line"><!---->If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label.           Comment 19<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      cclao@google.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2933280089" title="cclao@google.com"><!---->cclao@google.com<!----></a>
      cclao@google.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->cclao@google.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c19">Comment 19<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 15, 2022, 7:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I think what happened is that ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex) will always allocate space for the default attributes, regardless if the attribute index is enabled or not. Then it calls vertexArrayVk->updateDefaultAttrib(), which only updates mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex] if it is enabled:    <span class="line"><!---->I think what happened is that ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex) will always allocate space for the default attributes, regardless if the attribute index is enabled or not. Then it calls vertexArrayVk-&gt;updateDefaultAttrib(), which only updates mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex] if it is enabled:    <!----></span><br><br>if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))<span class="line"><!---->if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBufferHandles[attribIndex] = bufferHandle;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBufferHandles[attribIndex] = bufferHandle;<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex] = offset;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBufferOffsets[attribIndex] = offset;<!----></span><br>        mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]       = buffer;<span class="line"><!---->        mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]       = buffer;<!----></span><br><br>        ANGLE_TRY(setDefaultPackedInput(contextVk, attribIndex));<span class="line"><!---->        ANGLE_TRY(setDefaultPackedInput(contextVk, attribIndex));<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>This means if mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex)) is true, mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]  will still point to the previous buffer, which may have been pushed to mInflightBuffers by this call:<span class="line"><!---->This means if mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex)) is true, mCurrentArrayBuffers[attribIndex]  will still point to the previous buffer, which may have been pushed to mInflightBuffers by this call:<!----></span><br><br>angle::Result ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex)<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result ContextVk::updateDefaultAttribute(size_t attribIndex)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    vk::BufferHelper *defaultBuffer;<span class="line"><!---->    vk::BufferHelper *defaultBuffer;<!----></span><br>    ANGLE_TRY(allocateStreamedVertexBuffer(attribIndex, kDefaultValueSize, &defaultBuffer));<span class="line"><!---->    ANGLE_TRY(allocateStreamedVertexBuffer(attribIndex, kDefaultValueSize, &amp;defaultBuffer));<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>And then at submission time, we decided to release the mInflightBuffers, the BufferHelper object gets deleted (note, the underline VkBuffer will be garbage collected instead of immediately destroyed, but the helper object gets destructed), while mCurrentArrayBuffers still pointing to it, thus the use-after-free.<span class="line"><!---->And then at submission time, we decided to release the mInflightBuffers, the BufferHelper object gets deleted (note, the underline VkBuffer will be garbage collected instead of immediately destroyed, but the helper object gets destructed), while mCurrentArrayBuffers still pointing to it, thus the use-after-free.<!----></span><br><br>The easy fix is to add  `if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))` check before calling allocateStreamedVertexBuffer() so that we do not waste time to allocate and not use it, and mean time fix this bug as well.<span class="line"><!---->The easy fix is to add  `if (!mState.getEnabledAttributesMask().test(attribIndex))` check before calling allocateStreamedVertexBuffer() so that we do not waste time to allocate and not use it, and mean time fix this bug as well.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

Then we call into<span class="line"><!---->default attribute, regardless it is enabled or not. This causes a use-after-free scenario that if it<span class="line"><!---->attribute is enabled. This causes a use-after-free scenario that if it<!----></span><br>is disabled, the vertex array may have a pointer to the buffer that is<span class="line"><!---->is disabled, the vertex array may have a pointer to the buffer that is<!----></span><br>now becomes inflight which may gets deleted when DynamicBuffer code<span class="line"><!---->now becomes inflight which may gets deleted when DynamicBuffer code<!----></span><br>think the size no longer matches etc.<span class="line"><!---->think the size no longer matches etc.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1296467<a           Comment 21<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1296467#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

See <!----></span>comment #23<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c23"><!---->comment #23<!----></a>, it appears already rolled into chromium. Let me know if my understanding is incorrect, or still seeing the bug.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

            Discard
          </chops-button>
          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>
    
    </chops-dialog>
    <mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog id="update-issue-hotlists"></mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog>


        
      <div class="snackbar-container" aria-live="polite">
        
      </div>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
